content: The test-cases should NOT include an EM DASH when the description disallows it.
It would be good to have the quote characters present in some of the visible test cases too.

Input / Output
* You have not written proper descriptions in Input and Output sections yet. Please write a description instead of an example:

   • Input: Is the input in every case always "clash of code is fun"? Obviously not. Just state this:
<<Line 1>>: A string [[sentence]].

   • Output: Is the output in every case always 
"hsalc fo edoc si nuf"? Obviously not. Just state this:
<<Line 1>>: [[sentence]] after transformation.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A mirror word by word, a little difficult than a simple mirror but fun

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice, a bit of complexity, but nothing too hard. Could be nice for min code size too

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: quickly solvable and fun

Comment: Good for shortest and reverse modes

Comment: it easy, but not very easy
Very good do more of these

Goal / Cases
* The input strings contain letters and space characters only, no digits or basic punctuation as claimed in the statement. Please modify Goal section and/or add more cases so that they're consistent.

* Similar to the above point, the punctuation rule is irrelevant in the current cases.

Input
* Please write a proper description instead of an example. Refer to the example here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Output
* Same comment as Input section above.

Cases
* Each test should be similar to, but not the same as, its corresponding validator. Please revise the cases accordingly.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Game modes
* You may as well enable Shortest and Reverse modes.

Thanks.
Thank you for the advice. I've made the changes now.

Goal / Cases
* The input strings do not contain any digits as claimed in the statement. Please modify Goal section and/or add more cases so that they're consistent.

Input / Output
* You have not written proper descriptions in Input and Output sections yet. Please write a description instead of an example.

Thanks.
